name: video-frame-extractor
title: Video Frame Extractor
description: Extract frames from videos at specified intervals or timestamps
content:
Overview

This application extracts individual frames from video files at specified intervals or specific timestamps. Built using OpenCV, it provides high-quality frame extraction for video analysis, thumbnail creation, or creating image sequences.

Features

  • Extract frames at regular time intervals
  • Extract frames at specific timestamps
  • High-quality JPEG output with 95% quality
  • Automatic video property detection (fps, duration, resolution)

Parameters

  • Input Video: Upload your video file from stash
  • Extraction Mode: Choose between interval-based or timestamp-based extraction
  • Interval: Time in seconds between frames (for interval mode)
  • Timestamps: Comma-separated timestamps in seconds (for timestamp mode)
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

Output

The application generates JPEG image files for each extracted frame, named with the timestamp (e.g., video_frame_1.50s.jpg).

Use Cases

  • Creating image sequences from videos
  • Extracting specific moments for analysis
  • Video quality assessment
  • Creating storyboards or contact sheets
command: REPO_DIR="prod_apps_${RANDOM}_${RANDOM}"; rm -rf "$REPO_DIR" 2>/dev/null || true; [ ! -d "$REPO_DIR" ] && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git "$REPO_DIR" && python "$REPO_DIR/python/video_frame_extractor.py" "${videoFile}" -o "${outputDir}" -i "${interval}" ${timestamps:+-t "${timestamps}"}
